comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://item.rakuten.co.jp/asus-store/a940w8h/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fitem.rakuten.co.jp%2Fasus-store%2Fa940w8h%2F) ### Comment > When I search or view products on rakuten,the site doesn't respond or often crashes and takes longer to display products. > > I tried to find out how to reproduce crashing website and noticed that it might be easier to reproduce by using Private Browsing(safari) in my end. > > I reported this issue to support adguard and got advice that try to reinstall adguard. After doing that this issue occurred again so I recorded videos that shows this issue. Please check the videos if you feel like it. > I don't know how to share videos when I report issues,so I uploaded them to google drive. > Video1 shows when adguard disabled and Video2 shows adguard enabled. I did the same operation in scrolling as possible. > > Video1 url:https://drive.google.com/file/d/1SZGyIWTBP8F3f-cCFUHxLHWuhygHCGTi/view?usp=drivesdk > > Video2 url: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1kkjTneV3Y5dA9L117GTCagsYzwz9iQFv/view?usp=drivesdk > ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/hnnynwq981s0sosoc0gk8004cw0gsswhtxwb3oq1vk.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/82twtsn80hgcs00g88c084o84skw000pcci2doqwuo.png?nc=1)

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
Thanks for testing. We are investigating the root cause of the issue. In the meantime, you can use this as custom rule temporarily:

```adblock
||fonts.googleapis.com/earlyaccess/$domain=research.net|surveymonkey.com
```

The rule is also for this same issue: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/206276 .

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [x] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

uBlock Origin v1.64.0

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

other (specify in comment below)

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.tv2.no/livesport/fotball/kamper/

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

### Privacy

AdGuard Tracking Protection filter

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

_No response_

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

### Issue:
Blocked assets / broken functions.

### Examples:
https://www.tv2.no/livesport/fotball/kamper/
https://www.tv2.no/livesport/fotball/kamper/estland-norge/077228c0-1d6a-5415-a5b5-00c0c7678abc/

### Screenshots:
https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a74eb6ea-8702-4e46-9d27-788d29e2dbd2
https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e693fb82-76d3-4e08-9c2b-bc997ddc212d

### Problem filter:
* **AdGuard Tracking Protection filter**

### Problem rule:
`/snowplow.*.js$domain=~snowplow.io`

### Possible fix:
```
- /snowplow.*.js$domain=~snowplow.io

+ /snowplow.*.js$domain=~nrk.no|~prolific.co|~rossmann.pl|~snowplow.io|~tv2.no
```
**Note:** I've included other domains too, since '**Frellwit's Swedish Filter**' also contains `snowplow` exceptions for them.

### Other problem filters:
* ~~**Frellwit's Swedish Filter** https://github.com/lassekongo83/Frellwits-filter-lists/issues/187#issuecomment-2957086173~~ **_(FIXED)_**
~~`/snowplow$script,domain=~rossmann.pl|~prolific.co|~nrk.no`~~

--

### System info:
* OS/version: Windows 10 Pro 22H2 (x64)
* Browser/version: LibreWolf v139.0.1-1 (x64) [Tracking Protection = Standard]
* Adblock Extension/version: uBlock Origin v1.64.0

```
- /snowplow.*.js$domain=~snowplow.io

+ /snowplow.*.js$domain=~nrk.no|~prolific.co|~rossmann.pl|~snowplow.io|~tv2.no
```
**Note:** I've included other domains too, since '**Frellwit's Swedish Filter**' also contains `snowplow` exceptions for them.

### Other problem filters:
* ~~**Frellwit's Swedish Filter** https://github.com/lassekongo83/Frellwits-filter-lists/issues/187#issuecomment-2957086173~~ **_(FIXED)_**
~~`/snowplow$script,domain=~rossmann.pl|~prolific.co|~nrk.no`~~

--

### System info:
* OS/version: Windows 10 Pro 22H2 (x64)
* Browser/version: LibreWolf v139.0.1-1 (x64) [Tracking Protection = Standard]
* Adblock Extension/version: uBlock Origin v1.64.0

### Privacy

- [x] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body: I've excluded `tv2.no`, but what happens to the others?

comment.body: @piquark6046 @Alex-302 This is an opposite case, the `en` subdomai clearly indicates this is an International site, so you had to remove `en` to apply the rule to all subdomains. BTW do not gamble with such a very risky selector. `.mb-e-30` only means it's `maragin-bottom` is `30px`, can cause whole page hiding in any future change by the site.

The one with a black screen and white text was captured on June 2. Its possible that Bilibili recently received feedback and adjusted the way errors are displayed, which is why the two screenshots look different. > > Although the black-screen screenshot doesnt show the full browser window (including the extension icons), I can confirm it was taken on June 2 with AdGuard enabled on that page. > Username: `@shenxianxin` ### Screenshots

comment.body:
Ok understood.

Anyway, adding this url to https blocking list resolved the issue.

I think adding viously.com to adguard base filter is not the solution because it will generate conflicts and videos will not load correctly.

I will keep this exception in my adguard settings.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.youku.com/ku/webhome](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youku.com%2Fku%2Fwebhome) ### Comment > The website issue has recently occurred > Website 404 due to incorrect filtering rules when redirecting videos > I have received a successful feedback regarding the launch of the iQiyi website > AdGuard URL Tracking filter > Legitimate URL Shortener > The feedback that caused the website to fail to redirect was that I reinstalled the plugin and turned off all functions. Even after enabling only the above functions, I still couldn't redirect, so I had to turn off and redirect > I found during testing that if I open all the filtered content on this website, the plugin crashes and needs to be reinstalled. I have triggered it about 8 times, and I only open it > AdGuard URL Tracking filter > Legitimate URL Shortener > These two items, as well as the forced activation of Chinese language filtering without any other filtering, will also work well. If the plugin crashes and needs to be reinstalled, the probability is very small ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/jl6xj8kuw8ow4g8ggc80c4sook00sko773fxmam8mo.png?nc=1)
